D.A.G.O.A.

OFFICIAL COMMUNIQUÉ

Regarding the Urgent and Unsanctioned Misalignment of Ambient Phenomenological Standards.

Our Mandate

The Department of Atmospheric Grievances & Olfactory Affairs (DAGOA) is the principal municipal body tasked with the codification, audit, and enforcement of ambient phenomenological standards. Our jurisdiction covers, but is not limited to, the structural integrity of sunbeams, the acoustic properties of purrs, and the unacceptable rustling of certain synthetic fabrics.

We exist to correct the universe's gross administrative errors. The morning sunbeam, for instance, has been arriving 4.7 degrees off-center since Q2. This is an unacceptable deviation.

Active Dockets

Our auditors are currently investigating several high-priority infractions. Findings will be published following a mandatory 90-day period of intense, uninterrupted napping.

REG. 7B.4-1

The Sunbeam Integrity Act. To mandate minimum lux values and enforce trajectory consistency for all domestic solar incursions.

DIR. 11-C

Mandated Napping Intervals & Acceptable Surfaces. Prohibits the placement of cold, non-pliable objects on designated slumber zones.

AUDIT #451-A

A scathing review of "The Unacceptable Crinkle-to-Volume Ratio of Modern Snack Packaging." Recommends immediate cessation of 93% of all polymer-based food containers.

INQUIRY #9-Z

Investigating the sudden, inexplicable disappearance of small, unattended objects from elevated flat surfaces. A phenomenon colloquially known as "greebling."

File a Grievance

While we appreciate public vigilance, the process for lodging a formal complaint is necessarily complex to deter frivolous submissions (e.g., complaints regarding "the dog").

PROCEDURE FOR SUBMISSION: 1. Obtain Form 74-C (Request for Phenomenological Re-Evaluation). 2. Form 74-C is available only from our third-floor office on the second Tuesday of months containing the letter 'R', between the hours of 14:00 and 14:03 local time. Do not be late. 3. Complete the form in triplicate using a pen with non-smudging, fish-scented ink. 4. The form must be witnessed and signed by two (2) individuals who are not you, but have observed the grievance independently. 5. Submit all three copies by sliding them under our main office door. Do not knock. We know you are there. Await our non-response.
